>From: Derek James <djames@...>

>If at some point a significant amount of that neutral structure is
>exploited by the network, then it might be worth it, but again, I'm
>highly skeptical of this.  I think it makes much more sense to try to
>only keep around mutations that show an immediate payoff for fitness,
>even if it is slight.

Isn't this whole discussion moot?  Between fitness sharing, fixed size 
populations, and selective reproduction, haven't we already biased things 
towards mutations that are beneficial?
